get.description: Returns a list of activities for the selected asset or album. The activities are returned in sorted order, with the oldest activities appearing first.

post.description: Create a like or a comment for an album, or an asset in an album.

get.description: Returns the number of likes and comments for a given album or asset in an album.

delete.description: Removes a like or comment from a given album or asset in an album.

post.description: Unlinks all OAuth accounts associated with user accounts in the system.
Put Immich into or take it out of maintenance mode
Login with maintenance token or cookie to receive current information and perform further actions.
Create a new notification for a specific user.
Retrieve a preview of the provided email template.
Send a test email using the provided SMTP configuration.

get.description: Search for users.

post.description: Create a new user.

delete.description: Delete a user.

get.description: Retrieve  a specific user by their ID.

put.description: Update an existing user.

get.description: Retrieve the preferences of a specific user.

put.description: Update the preferences of a specific user.

post.description: Restore a previously deleted user.

get.description: Retrieve all sessions for a specific user.
Retrieve asset statistics for a specific user.
Retrieve a list of albums available to the authenticated user.

post.description: Create a new album. The album can also be created with initial users and assets.

put.description: Send a list of asset IDs and album IDs to add each asset to each album.

get.description: Returns statistics about the albums available to the authenticated user.

delete.description: Delete a specific album by its ID. Note the album is initially trashed and then immediately scheduled for deletion, but relies on a background job to complete the process.

get.description: Retrieve information about a specific album by its ID.

patch.description: Update the information of a specific album by its ID. This endpoint can be used to update the album name, description, sort order, etc. However, it is not used to add or remove assets or users from the album.

delete.description: Remove multiple assets from a specific album by its ID.

put.description: Add multiple assets to a specific album by its ID.

delete.description: Remove a user from an album. Use an ID of "me" to leave a shared album.

put.description: Change the role for a specific user in a specific album.
Share an album with multiple users. Each user can be given a specific role in the album.

get.description: Retrieve all API keys of the current user.

post.description: Creates a new API key. It will be limited to the permissions specified.

get.description: Retrieve the API key that is used to access this endpoint.

delete.description: Deletes an API key identified by its ID. The current user must own this API key.

get.description: Retrieve an API key by its ID. The current user must own this API key.

put.description: Updates the name and permissions of an API key by its ID. The current user must own this API key.

delete.description: Deletes multiple assets at the same time.

post.description: Uploads a new asset to the server.

parameters.name: x-immich-checksum
parameters.description: sha1 checksum that can be used for duplicate detection before the file is uploaded

put.description: Updates multiple assets at the same time.

post.description: Determine which assets have already been uploaded to the server based on their SHA1 checksums.

put.description: Copy asset information like albums, tags, etc. from one asset to another.

get.description: Get all asset of a device that are in the database, ID only.

post.description: Checks if multiple assets exist on the server and returns all existing - used by background backup
Run a specific job on a set of assets.

get.description: Retrieve a specified number of random assets for the authenticated user.
Retrieve various statistics about the assets owned by the authenticated user.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific asset.

put.description: Update information of a specific asset.

get.description: Retrieve all metadata key-value pairs associated with the specified asset.

put.description: Update or add metadata key-value pairs for the specified asset.

delete.description: Delete a specific metadata key-value pair associated with the specified asset.

get.description: Retrieve the value of a specific metadata key associated with the specified asset.
Retrieve all OCR (Optical Character Recognition) data associated with the specified asset.
Downloads the original file of the specified asset.

put.description: Replace the asset with new file, without changing its id.

get.description: Retrieve the thumbnail image for the specified asset.
Streams the video file for the specified asset. This endpoint also supports byte range requests.

post.description: Create the first admin user in the system.
Change the password of the current user.
Login with username and password and receive a session token.
Logout the current user and invalidate the session token.

delete.description: Reset the pin code for the current user by providing the account password

post.description: Setup a new pin code for the current user.

put.description: Change the pin code for the current user.

post.description: Remove elevated access to locked assets from the current session.
Temporarily grant the session elevated access to locked assets by providing the correct PIN code.

get.description: Get information about the current session, including whether the user has a password, and if the session can access locked assets.

post.description: Validate the current authorization method is still valid.
Download a ZIP archive containing the specified assets. The assets must have been previously requested via the "getDownloadInfo" endpoint.
Retrieve information about how to request a download for the specified assets or album. The response includes groups of assets that can be downloaded together.

delete.description: Delete multiple duplicate assets specified by their IDs.

get.description: Retrieve a list of duplicate assets available to the authenticated user.

delete.description: Delete a single duplicate asset specified by its ID.

get.description: Retrieve all faces belonging to an asset.

post.description: Create a new face that has not been discovered by facial recognition. The content of the bounding box is considered a face.

delete.description: Delete a face identified by the id. Optionally can be force deleted.

put.description: Re-assign the face provided in the body to the person identified by the id in the path parameter.
put.summary: Re-assign a face to another person

get.description: Retrieve the counts of the current queue, as well as the current status.

post.description: Run a specific job. Most jobs are queued automatically, but this endpoint allows for manual creation of a handful of jobs, including various cleanup tasks, as well as creating a new database backup.

put.description: Queue all assets for a specific job type. Defaults to only queueing assets that have not yet been processed, but the force command can be used to re-process all assets.

get.description: Retrieve a list of external libraries.

post.description: Create a new external library.

get.description: Retrieve statistics for a specific external library, including number of videos, images, and storage usage.

post.description: Validate the settings of an external library.

get.description: Retrieve a list of latitude and longitude coordinates for every asset with location data.
Retrieve location information (e.g., city, country) for given latitude and longitude coordinates.
Retrieve a list of memories. Memories are sorted descending by creation date by default, although they can also be sorted in ascending order, or randomly.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of memories to return

get.description: Retrieve statistics about memories, such as total count and other relevant metrics.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of memories to return

Link an OAuth account to the authenticated user.

put.description: Bulk reassign a list of faces to a different person.

get.description: Retrieve statistics about a specific person.
Retrieve the thumbnail file for a person.
Retrieve a list of assets with each asset belonging to a different city. This endpoint is used on the places pages to show a single thumbnail for each city the user has assets in.
Retrieve data for the explore section, such as popular people and places.

post.description: Search for assets that are considered large based on specified criteria.
Search for assets based on various metadata criteria.

get.description: Search for people by name.
Search for places by name.

post.description: Retrieve a random selection of assets based on the provided criteria.
Perform a smart search for assets by using machine learning vectors to determine relevance.
Retrieve statistical data about assets based on search criteria, such as the total matching count.

get.description: Retrieve search suggestions based on partial input. This endpoint is used for typeahead search features.

Retrieve links to the APKs for the current server version.

Retrieve available features supported by this server.

get.description: Retrieve a string of all asset ids in a given time bucket.

parameters.name: albumId
parameters.description: Filter assets belonging to a specific album

parameters.name: isFavorite
parameters.description: Filter by favorite status (true for favorites only, false for non-favorites only)

parameters.name: isTrashed
parameters.description: Filter by trash status (true for trashed assets only, false for non-trashed only)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order for assets within time buckets (ASC for oldest first, DESC for newest first)

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: Filter assets containing a specific person (face recognition)

parameters.name: tagId
parameters.description: Filter assets with a specific tag

parameters.name: timeBucket
parameters.description: Time bucket identifier in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., "2024-01-01" for January 2024)

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Filter assets by specific user ID

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Filter by asset visibility status (ARCHIVE, TIMELINE, HIDDEN, LOCKED)

parameters.name: withCoordinates
parameters.description: Include location data in the response

parameters.name: withPartners
parameters.description: Include assets shared by partners

parameters.name: withStacked
parameters.description: Include stacked assets in the response. When true, only primary assets from stacks are returned.

parameters.description: Filter assets by specific user ID

parameters.description: Filter by asset visibility status (ARCHIVE, TIMELINE, HIDDEN, LOCKED)

parameters.description: Include location data in the response

parameters.name: withStacked
parameters.description: Include stacked assets in the response. When true, only primary assets from stacks are returned.

tags.name: Activities
tags.description: An activity is a like or a comment made by a user on an asset or album.

tags.name: Albums
tags.description: An album is a collection of assets that can be shared with other users or via shared links.

tags.name: API keys
tags.description: An api key can be used to programmatically access the Immich API.

tags.name: Assets
tags.description: An asset is an image or video that has been uploaded to Immich.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoints related to user authentication, including OAuth.

tags.name: Authentication (admin)
tags.description: Administrative endpoints related to authentication.

tags.name: Deprecated
tags.description: Deprecated endpoints that are planned for removal in the next major release.

tags.name: Download
tags.description: Endpoints for downloading assets or collections of assets.

tags.name: Duplicates
tags.description: Endpoints for managing and identifying duplicate assets.

tags.name: Faces
tags.description: A face is a detected human face within an asset, which can be associated with a person. Faces are normally detected via machine learning, but can also be created via manually.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: Queues and background jobs are used for processing tasks asynchronously. Queues can be paused and resumed as needed.

tags.name: Libraries
tags.description: An external library is made up of input file paths or expressions that are scanned for asset files. Discovered files are automatically imported. Assets much be unique within a library, but can be duplicated across libraries. Each user has a default upload library, and can have one or more external libraries.

tags.name: Maintenance (admin)
tags.description: Maintenance mode allows you to put Immich in a read-only state to perform various operations.

tags.name: Map
tags.description: Map endpoints include supplemental functionality related to geolocation, such as reverse geocoding and retrieving map markers for assets with geolocation data.

tags.name: Memories
tags.description: A memory is a specialized collection of assets with dedicated viewing implementations in the web and mobile clients. A memory includes fields related to visibility and are automatically generated per user via a background job.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: A notification is a specialized message sent to users to inform them of important events. Currently, these notifications are only shown in the Immich web application.

tags.name: Notifications (admin)
tags.description: Notification administrative endpoints.

tags.name: Partners
tags.description: A partner is a link with another user that allows sharing of assets between two users.

tags.name: People
tags.description: A person is a collection of faces, which can be favorited and named. A person can also be merged into another person. People are automatically created via the face recognition job.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Endpoints related to searching assets via text, smart search, optical character recognition (OCR), and other filters like person, album, and other metadata. Search endpoints usually support pagination and sorting.

tags.name: Server
tags.description: Information about the current server deployment, including version and build information, available features, supported media types, and more.

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description: A session represents an authenticated login session for a user. Sessions also appear in the web application as "Authorized devices".

tags.name: Shared links
tags.description: A shared link is a public url that provides access to a specific album, asset, or collection of assets. A shared link can be protected with a password, include a specific slug, allow or disallow downloads, and optionally include an expiration date.

tags.name: Stacks
tags.description: A stack is a group of related assets. One asset is the "primary" asset, and the rest are "child" assets. On the main timeline, stack parents are included by default, while child assets are hidden.

tags.name: Sync
tags.description: A collection of endpoints for the new mobile synchronization implementation.

tags.name: System config
tags.description: Endpoints to view, modify, and validate the system configuration settings.

tags.name: System metadata
tags.description: Endpoints to view, modify, and validate the system metadata, which includes information about things like admin onboarding status.

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: A tag is a user-defined label that can be applied to assets for organizational purposes. Tags can also be hierarchical, allowing for parent-child relationships between tags.

tags.name: Timeline
tags.description: Specialized endpoints related to the timeline implementation used in the web application. External applications or tools should not use or rely on these endpoints, as they are subject to change without notice.

tags.name: Trash
tags.description: Endpoints for managing the trash can, which includes assets that have been discarded. Items in the trash are automatically deleted after a configured amount of time.

tags.name: Users (admin)
tags.description: Administrative endpoints for managing users, including creating, updating, deleting, and restoring users. Also includes endpoints for resetting passwords and PIN codes.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Endpoints for viewing and updating the current users, including product key information, profile picture data, onboarding progress, and more.

tags.name: Views
tags.description: Endpoints for specialized views, such as the folder view.

city.description: Array of city names extracted from EXIF GPS data

country.description: Array of country names extracted from EXIF GPS data

duration.description: Array of video durations in HH:MM:SS format (null for images)

fileCreatedAt.description: Array of file creation timestamps in UTC (ISO 8601 format, without timezone)

id.description: Array of asset IDs in the time bucket

isFavorite.description: Array indicating whether each asset is favorited

isImage.description: Array indicating whether each asset is an image (false for videos)

isTrashed.description: Array indicating whether each asset is in the trash

latitude.description: Array of latitude coordinates extracted from EXIF GPS data

livePhotoVideoId.description: Array of live photo video asset IDs (null for non-live photos)

localOffsetHours.description: Array of UTC offset hours at the time each photo was taken. Positive values are east of UTC, negative values are west of UTC. Values may be fractional (e.g., 5.5 for +05:30, -9.75 for -09:45). Applying this offset to 'fileCreatedAt' will give you the time the photo was taken from the photographer's perspective.

longitude.description: Array of longitude coordinates extracted from EXIF GPS data

ownerId.description: Array of owner IDs for each asset

projectionType.description: Array of projection types for 360 content (e.g., "EQUIRECTANGULAR", "CUBEFACE", "CYLINDRICAL")

ratio.description: Array of aspect ratios (width/height) for each asset

stack.description: Array of stack information as [stackId, assetCount] tuples (null for non-stacked assets)

thumbhash.description: Array of BlurHash strings for generating asset previews (base64 encoded)

visibility.description: Array of visibility statuses for each asset (e.g., ARCHIVE, TIMELINE, HIDDEN, LOCKED)
